channel.title: Conviction: The Disappearance of Nuseiba Hasan
channel.description: Nobody seems to know what happened to Nuseiba Hasan. She’s a Jordanian-Canadian woman, who, in 2006, suddenly vanished without a trace. That is until someone from her past resurfaced, searching for justice. For the last three years, investigative journalist Habiba Nosheen has been trying to find out what happened to Nuseiba. But some people want the truth to stay hidden.

image.title: Conviction: The Disappearance of Nuseiba Hasan

item.title: Episode 8: Family Secrets (Season 3)
item.description: We learn about the rumors that have been circulating about Nuseiba’s disappearance. And Habiba finds out the truth about why so many people have stayed quiet for so many years about what happened to Nuseiba. Also, an unexpected person reaches out to Habiba following the release of the episodes. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 7: The Farm (Season 3)
item.description: Habiba pieces together what police were looking for as they searched a 55-acre farm outside Hamilton and she persuades a family member who's stayed silent until now to talk. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 6: Persons of Interest (Season 3)
item.description: Habiba gets her hands on a new document that reveals the once-hidden details about the investigation into Nuseiba’s disappearance. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 5: The Statement (Season 3)
item.description: Habiba discovers a dramatic series of events leading up to Nuseiba giving up her daughter. Also, she learns more about the person who Nuseiba once told the police had “strangled” her. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 4: The Crow Flies at Midnight (Season 3)
item.description: Habiba discovers the consequences Nuseiba faced after her call to Children's Aid.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 3: Ghosts of Nuseiba’s Past (Season 3)
item.description: Habiba learns about a key moment that likely changed the course of Nuseiba’s life. And a surprising visit from a SWAT team. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 2: Trail Stopped Cold (Season 3)
item.description: Habiba sits down with key people in the investigation and gets two wildly different theories about what happened to Nuseiba. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 1: Secret Daughter (Season 3)
item.description: A cryptic email arrives urging investigative journalist Habiba Nosheen to look into the disappearance of a woman named Nuseiba Hasan. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Season 3 Preview: Parallel Worlds
item.description: Investigative journalist Habiba Nosheen finds herself reading a cryptic email about the disappearance of a woman named Nuseiba Hasan. As she investigates, Habiba finds eerie parallels between her life and the life of this missing woman. Those parallels fuel her determination to unravel the mystery of Nuseiba Hasan, a 26 year old woman, who one day, just vanished.Conviction: The Disappearance of Nuseiba Hasan premieres February 22. Follow and listen for free on Spotify. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Introducing Conviction Season 3: The Disappearance of Nuseiba Hasan
item.description: Nobody seems to know what happened to Nuseiba Hasan. She’s a Jordanian-Canadian woman, who, in 2006, suddenly vanished without a trace. That is until someone from her past resurfaced, searching for justice. For the last three years, investigative journalist Habiba Nosheen has been trying to find out what happened to Nuseiba. But some people want the truth to stay hidden.Conviction: The Disappearance of Nuseiba Hasan is out now. Follow and stream all episodes for free, only on Spotify. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: Episode 8: Reunion (Season 2)
item.description: After 23 years, John comes face to face with his father Melvin.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 7: The Kids Grow Up (Season 2)
item.description: More than a decade after the first allegations of satanic ritual abuse in California, the Satanic Panic was mostly snuffed out. The nation began to move on. But the children at the heart of it were just beginning to reckon with their past. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 6: The State vs. Melvin Quinney (Season 2)
item.description: In the summer of 1991, Melvin Quinney was put on trial. The prime witness against him: his own son, John. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 5: The Making Of A Cult Victim (Season 2)
item.description: Back in Texas, after Debbie Quinney accused her husband of abusing his children and leading a satanic cult, their children were placed in a shelter. Not long after this, nine-year-old John Quinney entered a controversial form of psychotherapy that was hugely popular in the 1980s. Today, he thinks that therapy might have brainwashed him. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 4: How Do You Outrun A Panic? (Season 2)
item.description: By 1985, California was fully engulfed in a panic. People were convinced that there was an underground network of satanists abusing children right under their noses, and everyone was a suspect. Children who were taken away for questioning often didn't return. Parents, friends, and neighbors were arrested without evidence to support the charges. In the midst of this frenzy, one family packed their bags and made a break for it. In this episode, what it’s like to try to outrun a panic. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 3: Believe The Children (Season 2)
item.description: In the 1980s, protecting the safety of children became a paramount concern. It was the one issue that could unite even the most disparate factions of society, from radical leftists to Christian conservatives. But the movement to protect children quickly morphed into an all-consuming panic that pushed parents, therapists, and police to view all children as victims—even if the children claimed otherwise.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 2: The Panic Begins (Season 2)
item.description: We trace the roots of the Satanic Panic back to a strange Canadian memoir, Michelle Remembers. In it, a woman named Michelle describes satanic rituals she was forced to participate in as a child. She “recovered” these memories with the help of her psychotherapist, who coined the term ritual abuse. In this episode, we track how the idea of satanic ritual abuse jumped from the pages of a suspicious book into police departments across North America. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 1: Meet the Quinneys (Season 2)
item.description: In 1989, nine-year-old John Quinney accused his father Melvin of being a satanic cult leader and abusing him in satanic rituals. His father vehemently denied the charges. It was a case that tore their family apart. But what none of them knew was that they were just one of dozens of families going through the same nightmare. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Introducing Conviction Season 2: American Panic
item.description: When John Quinney was ten years old, he took the stand to testify against his own father. He had come to believe that his dad Melvin was the murderous leader of a satanic cult. It would be decades before John would learn that his family was just one of many swept up in a panic that gripped America in the 1980s—one in which hundreds of people were accused of taking part in underground satanic cults that sacrificed infants and sexually abused children. By the time the panic had subsided, scores of people were in prison, convicted on little to no evidence—people like John's father. Conviction: American Panic takes you inside one of the darkest and most bizarre chapters of American history.Conviction: American Panic premieres February 25. Follow and listen for free on Spotify. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.description: Pedro’s trial date finally arrives, and Manny sets out on another quest. Will he finally push the envelope too far?  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Episode 1: The Private Eye (Season 1)
item.description: Private Investigator Manuel Gomez takes on the biggest case of his career: the case of Pedro Hernandez. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Conviction: Season 1 Trailer
item.description: Manny Gomez is a detective straight out of a detective novel. He carries a pen that’s really a knife, wears a watch that’s really a camera, adores Sherlock Holmes and Miami Vice. But the cases Manny takes on are all too real: cases of young men in New York City who say they’ve been arrested for crimes they didn’t commit. In the first season of Conviction, reporter Saki Knafo follows Manny as he tackles the biggest case of his career—and along the way, Saki explores big questions about criminal justice in America. This story is the first in Gimlet Media’s Conviction series, which will feature a new piece of investigative reporting each season. Hear all the episodes on February 4th.  Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
